    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    Chest.open(GameContext gameContext, IEffect effect)
    Opens the chest if it hasn't been opened yet If the chest is already opened, it notifies the player Upon opening, the item inside the chest is added to the current room's inventory
    void
    IBox.open(GameContext gameContext, IEffect effect)
    Opens the chest and reveals its contents This method is called when the player interacts with the chest.

  • Uses of GameContext in com.university.elements.items.effect

    Methods in com.university.elements.items.effect with parameters of type GameContext
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    AlarmEffect.apply(GameContext gameContext)
    Applies the alarm effect to the game, waking up the player by setting their sleep state to false and outputting a message
    void
    EatCakeEffect.apply(GameContext gameContext)
    Applies the effect of eating a cake, which increases the player's power points by 3 and displays a message indicating the effect
    void
    EatSandwichEffect.apply(GameContext gameContext)
    Applies the effect of eating a sandwich, which increases the player's power points by 10 and displays a message indicating the effect.
    void
    FreezeSpellEffect.apply(GameContext gameContext)
    Applies the freeze spell effect If the player is in a room containing a trap of type MadScientists or Trap, the trap's escape method is called using the FreezeSpellStrategy
    void
    HammerEffect.apply(GameContext gameContext)
    Applies the hammer effect.
    void
    IEffect.apply(GameContext gameContext)
    Applies the effect to the game context.
    void
    SausageEffect.apply(GameContext gameContext)
    Applies the sausage effect, allowing the player to escape a trap in the current room using the sausage strategy.
    void
    SleepEffect.apply(GameContext gameContext)
    Applies the sleep effect to the player asleep status to true
    void
    SpannerEffect.apply(GameContext gameContext)
    Applies the spanner effect, allowing the player to open a chest in the current room If the chest is already opened, a message is shown.
    void
    TeleportationEffect.apply(GameContext gameContext)
    Applies the teleportation effect, which teleports the player to a random room in the current dungeon The player is informed that they have used the teleportation spell and have been teleported
    void
    XRayEffect.apply(GameContext gameContext)
    Applies the X-Ray vision effect, allowing the player to look into a random adjacent room and see its contents The player is notified about the direction they are looking into, and if there is a trap in that room, the player is informed about the trap

  • Uses of GameContext in com.university.elements.traps

    Methods in com.university.elements.traps with parameters of type GameContext
    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    void
    CutieCat.activate(GameContext gameContext)
    Activates the CutieCat trap, immobilizing the player until they feed the cat or take the penalty
    void
    ITrap.activate(GameContext gameContext)
    Activates the trap in the context of the game.
    void
    MadScientists.activate(GameContext gameContext)
    Activates the Mad Scientists trap If the trap is still active, the player becomes trapped and cannot move
    void
    Trap.activate(GameContext gameContext)
    Activates the trap, immobilizing the player if the trap is still active
    void
    CutieCat.escape(GameContext gameContext, IEscapeStrategy escapeStrategy)
    Allows the player to escape the CutieCat trap by either feeding the cat or losing power points After escaping, the trap becomes inactive, and the player is no longer trapped
    void
    ITrap.escape(GameContext gameContext, IEscapeStrategy escapeStrategy)
    Allows the player to escape from the trap using a specific strategy.
    void
    MadScientists.escape(GameContext gameContext, IEscapeStrategy escapeStrategy)
    Allows the player to escape the trap using a provided strategy After successfully escaping, the trap becomes inactive, and the player is no longer trapped
    void
    Trap.escape(GameContext gameContext, IEscapeStrategy escapeStrategy)
    Allows the player to escape the trap using a provided strategy After successfully escaping, the trap becomes inactive, and the player is no longer trapped
